sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
I proclaime from the lord of hosts the returne of the Jewes from their captivity, and the building of the temple in glory, and in their owne land. Tany, Thomas, fl. 1649-1655.
1 sheet ([1] p.)
Printed by Charles Sumptner for Giles Calvert, and are to be sold at the Black-spread-Eagle, at the West-end of Paules, London : anno Dom, 1650.
Signed at end: Theauraviohn Tany [i.e. Thomas Tany]. Imprint from Wing. Annotation on Thomason copy (Thomason 669.f.17[3]): "may 1653 it came not sooner to hand". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
I proclaime from the lord of hosts the returne of the Jewes from their captivity, and the building of the temple in glory, and in their owne land. Tany, Thomas, fl. 1649-1655.
1 sheet ([1] p.)
Printed by Charles Sumptner for Giles Calvert, and are to be sold at the Black-spread-Eagle, at the West-end of Paules, London : anno Dom, 1650.
Signed at end: Theauraviohn Tany [i.e. Thomas Tany]. Imprint from Wing. Annotation on Thomason copy (Thomason 669.f.17[3]): "may 1653 it came not sooner to hand". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
Giles Calvert
Charles Sumptner
the Black-spread-Eagle, at the West-end of Paules
>>>>>>> imprintparse
